With a VM it can sometimes by hard to coordinate, but you have to be sure that your keyboard is captured before grub starts so that the fact that you're holding shift gets registered.
Thanks for that. Have just tried again, and it does seem to be booting using an earlier Kernel.  How can I remove the one that doesnt work properly ?

You could remove the package with apt/synaptic. But try just reconfiguring the package for that particular kernel version, it may have been interrupted in the process of installing when you powered off the VM.
